intro: Jacquemontia martii var. floribunda, commonly known as the showy golden vine, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and produces clusters of showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a hairy texture and thrives in warm, humid environments. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and attractive foliage. Jacquemontia martii var. floribunda is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other flowering vines.
